intro: Tetranthera floridana, commonly known as the Florida tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps, where it thrives in the understory. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale green. Tetranthera floridana is often found in wetlands and is an important component of the local flora in its native range.
